data.title: Enjoyed it very much
data.text: We were sat right away and one of the other reviews recommended the orange juice and it truly felt I was drinking fresh squeezed orange juice.  That started our visit off very well.  My son had the Eggs benedict and he said it was enjoyable.  I had the choco choco waffles with eggs and home fries and I was apprehensive about english cream so the server offered to have it on the side.  I must say, I found it very light and tasty.  Over all I felt the food was great and glad we had the experience.  May go back again while I am here visiting from Virginia.

data.title: Repeat Customer
data.text: Always a solid choice for breakfast. Prices are reasonable and portions are large. Kids eat free on Saturdays. Amber did a great job with the service and the manager came by to check on us which we always appreciate. They have our recommendation!

data.title: Great selection
data.text: Showed up during spring break. Our usual place near the beach was crowded and on a long wait. It was so funny watching it fill up and the servers and manager run around. I don't think they planned on getting slammed, but they kept it together.  The manager, a young lady, I wish I remembered her name was awesome! Very hands on and friendly. The food here is delicious.  Very fresh and good portion. I have since eaten here a few times. Once  with a picky friend who has celiac disease and has to have a cold glass of milk with breakfast. She too was impressed and that's not an easy thing to do. Love my neighborhood breakfast/ lunch place. Keep up the good work.

data.title: Proino is best restaurant in town
data.text:
Food is always fresh & portions are huge! By far the BEST BREAKFAST & LUNCH RESTAURANT IN LARGO!
Been coming here since they opened and food and service is always consistant. 
Bravo to the Diane & George! Keep doing what your doing because it's working!

data.title: So Good We Visited Twice
data.text: We chose Proino Breakfast Club for an authentic American breakfast experience on our first day in Florida based entirely on Trip Advisor reviews and it didn't disappoint. The food was beautifully prepared, tasty and plentiful and the waitresses were efficient, polite and attentive. Stacey (excuse any spelling mistakes) the manager spoke to us and answered our questions about things to do in the area. When we returned for breakfast on our last day in Florida she remembered us and asked how our stay had been; the epitome of excellent customer service.  I would certainly recommend the Proino Breakfast Club and will return if I ever visit the Gulf Coast again.

data.title: Very pleasant, good food
data.text: Came in for a quick lunch.  Nice to get breakfast options.  Waitstaff extremely pleasant and attentive. Clean, bright ambiance.  Food came quickly and was very good! Going to come back w my family sometime on the weekend for breakfast.

data.title: Hefty breakfast
data.text: Loved this place. Easy parking. Clean restaurant.  Ordered the brunch plate and got stuffed. Everything is fresh and menu is flexible if you want to make some substitutions. Pancakes, French toast, eggs, ham, potatoes, everything was great.

data.title: Large and very good breakfast
data.text: A lot of choices and big plates.  Friendly service and the manager is super kind. So if you are hunger this is the place to be

data.title: Lots of Choices
data.text: The menu has a lot to choose from. We have been here several times for breakfast and it has always been good. I believe it is on Saturdays that kids eat free. Whatever you order you will get plenty of it. Will not leave here hungry. We will go back for breakfast, can't speak for the lunch menu but I'm sure it would be similar. Good spot!

data.title: Good for BIG appetites
data.text:
Proino has great breakfasts which can be eaten for brunch as well.  Their five egg omelets are fantastic. You get good value for your money and the service is pleasant.

We were with a large group and there was a little problem getting everyone's food  to the table at the same time.

I recommend this place for family meals.  Not really a "date" or "celebtatory " place.

data.title: Breakfast = WOW
data.text: Stopped in for breakfast with some friends and was amazed when I saw the menu. Lots of options and everything sounded delicious, and I'm sure it is if it tastes as good as the omelet and fruit French toast I had. I'm sure we will be back.

data.title: Great Breakfast!
data.text: We were meeting friends for breakfast and found Proino's online. None of us had been there before, so decided to give it a try. Terrific food, huge portions, and very friendly staff! We will be back.

data.title: Something for All
data.text: Have only done breakfast but omg the dvariety of plates is overwhelming.. I wanted to try all.. The best part of each order is that is come with beautiful fresh fruit as a garnish.. Even the oj has a slice of orange!!!

data.title: A Breakfast Treat
data.text: The crepes are a special treat.  Good food and plenty to eat. A bit expensive, but not bad for what you get.

data.title: Great and breakfast
data.text: Had a great early breakfast with a coworker. We had the place to ourselves since it was 730am and we just got off work. The Steak and eggs and French toast was amazing. Will be back for sure

data.title: Monday morning breakfast
data.text:
Just had breakfast here with my family.  We've been coming here for years and the breakfast/fruit have always been fresh and delicious.  Not so this time.  The fruit was not ripe,,,but the prices are still very high

May not be back again.  Too many breakfast options in the Clearwater area

data.title: First time! We'll be back!
data.text:
My first visit to Proino's was quite excellent. I was immediately seated in a booth; the waitress, Lexi, brought coffee right away. The menu is large and diverse. All the breakfast favorites: eggs, crepes, several types of eggs Benedict, all types of omelets, pancakes & waffles, fresh fruit, and the list goes on! 

I ordered the smoked salmon platter, with a scrambled egg on the side. The food was delivered very quickly. The very generous serving of salmon was very fresh and flavorful with red onion slices, capers, and a toasted bagel. The scrambled egg was hot and fluffy. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal.

The manager, Stacy, stopped by the table to check on my meal. We had a pleasant conversation, during which I found out that Proino's Breakfast Club will be opening a location on South Clearwater Beach! Can't wait to have such a great place so close to home.

data.title: Innovative Menu
data.text: My friend and I come here often for breakfast and haven't had a bad item yet.  The menu is innovative from its homemade daily muffins, to creative omelets, to crepes, to its delicious O'Brien style potatoes and everything in-between!  While the West Bay Drive site is convenient for us, they also have a 2nd location in Largo off of Walmington St.    The prices are slightly higher than a diner but it is NOT a diner!  They also serve a lunch menu which I'm sure is just as delicious.

data.title: Great start to the day
data.text:
I'd picked this place out before our vacation as it sounded great, so we stopped by on our 1st morning and I wasn't disappointed, waiter was pleasant and patient with a couple of novices. 
Both our breakfasts were great, I had a lovely combo bacon, pancake, fruit, eggs, potatoes affair which really was delicious, great eggs. Only minor disappointing part was the industrial coffee but the rest was fabulous

data.title: A Truly Wonderful Breakfast Eatery
data.text: Delicious, large Greek and French breakfast portions served on a variety of extra large dishes. A bit pricey but I have invited many friends and relatives to join me and everyone felt the quantity, quality, flavor and presentations were worth it.
